title.narrative: WFAD - Förstudie om våldprevention och välbefinnande bland ungdomar i Kinshasa
WFAD - Prestudy on violence prevention and wellbeing among the youth in Kinshasa

description.narrative: The study was completed as planned, and the report was submitted and approved.

Violence caused by young people in Kinshasa is a major social problem and even a security problem in some parts of the city. The problem is explained by widespread poverty in households, high natality, lack of livelihoods and educational opportunities for young people, etc. Alcohol and drug abuse are among the most common direct causes of violent behavior among the youth in Kinshasa.
The YMCAV project is an initiative that has succeeded in getting many young people out of violent groups thanks to a group-oriented behavioral therapy and a certain mobilization of important actors in society (such as schools and the police). The project has shown some limitations, especially regarding sustainability, since the project did not include measures nor interventions to prevent young people from returning to the dangerous groups. In addition, the project coordination has been inadequate, with poor follow up by the lead partner, which lead to inappropriate management of funds.
Given their experience of working on similar issues in Eastern Europe and East Africa, WFAD has been offered this opportunity to use its expertise in the Congolese context as well. This contribution is to allow them to visit the project and conduct a feasibility study prior to their involvement. Language limitations may pose risks for WFAD to conduct this feasibility study. It can be solved by employing an experienced credible interpreter.

Våld orsakat av ungdomar i Kinshasa är ett stort samhälls- och även säkerhetsproblem i vissa delar av staden. Problematiken förklaras av en utbred fattigdom i hushållen, hög natalitet, brist på försörjnings- och utbildningsmöjligheter för ungdomar, etc. Alkohol och drogmissbruk är en av de vanligaste direkta orsakerna till våldsamma beteenden.
Young Men's Clubs Against Violence (YMCAV) projektet är ett initiativ som har lyckats med att få många ungdomar ur våldsamma grupper tack vare en grupporienterad beteendeterapi och en viss mobilisering av viktiga aktörer i samhället (såsom skolor och polisen). Projektet har visat på begränsningar speciellt gällande hållbarhet av projektets utfall. Projektet hade inga åtgärder för att förhindra att ungdomarna vänder tillbaka till de farliga grupperna. Dessutom har projektkoordineringen varit bristfällig.
Med sin erfarenhet av arbetet kring liknande frågor i Östra Europa och Östafrika vill ambassaden ge möjligheten till WFAD att även använda sin expertis i den kongolesiska kontexten. Språkbegränsningar kan utgöra risker för WFAD att genomföra denna förstudie. Den kan lösas genom att anlita en erfaren tolk.

description.narrative: The principal result of this intervention was that the study demonstrated that the Promundo-model of working with violent youth was not sustainable. The model was abandoned and an innovative one designed, which includes not only behavioral intervention targeting the youth but also concrete employment options in community critical aspects such as water collection and selling, urban sanitation, etc.
